column2:
This deck contains educational material from the Coronavirus Flashcards and which is in a form which can be easily learnt/revised using Anki a cross platform app.

Notes

Please note the following

  1. Every card has "(Coronavirus Flashcards)" appended to the end so that if you have any other virology related topics in your collection, our version will still be added when importing it.
  2. Any updates, translations or corrections to the deck will be available at https://github.com/darigovresearch/Coronavirus-Flashcards so do return periodically to check if you have the latest version.

Feel free to share the deck and give the repository a star so more people can get the most out of it.

column1: Introduction to Chapter 1 Glossary of terms (Coronavirus Flashcards)
column2: This chapter contains common terms on the topic listed in alphabetical order
A method of manufacturing that builds the part layer by layer
When someone is infected but does not exhibit symptoms
A Medical Condition that puts someone at a higher risk of either catching the virus or being more ill if they get infected
Acronym for the 'Centers for Disease Control and Prevention'
A specific strain of Coronavirus that was discovered and genetically sequenced in 2019
A family of viruses that have gotten their name as they look like a crown under a microscope
Some who has an immune system which isn't working correctly or not as well as in the wider population
A method of manufacturing which injections molten plastic into a mould
A method of manufacturing which produces a product just when it is needed which reduces cost of storage
A mathematical representation of a system that is used to analyse and predict a system
Acronym for National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health
Open source means that the source files of a given product (usually where commercial use is allowed)
Someone who is infected but does not yet exhibit any symptoms
The base reproductive rate in an SIR Model, it is the number of people that an infected person passes the disease onto
A mathematical that is used to model the spread of a disease
An idea where you choose to avoid other people to reduce the spread of a disease
When a disease mutates to become infectious for other species
A type of mask that designed to be used by medical professionals during medical procedures
Someone who does not have a disease but is likely to obtain
Observable detectible signs of an illness, injury, or condition
In virology this is something that transmits the spread of a disease, in mathematics it is an object which has magnitude and direction
A medical device that helps someone breath when they can't themselves
When a disease becomes infectious between species
